sources.title: Lighthouse
sources.description: Don Castle, June Lang, John Litel

sources.title: Lighthouse (1947) LOVE TRIANGLE
sources.description:
Stars: June Lang, Don Castle, John Litel 
Director: Frank Wisbar

Trouble brews at a distant lighthouse when a woman moves in with her new husband and the former flame who spurred her!

sources.title: Lighthouse (1947) Men Who Tame the Fury of the Seas...In Love With Their Kind of Woman!
sources.description:
When Connie marries Hank to spite his womanizing lighthouse partner Sam, the trio’s cramped quarters ignite a storm of jealousy—until a near-fatal accident forces Sam to choose between sabotage and redemption. Secrets crash like waves, but Hank’s trust in Connie might be the only beacon left.

Original title: Lighthouse (1947)

Director: Frank Wisbar
Writers: Robert B. Churchill, Don Martin 

Main cast:
Don Castle - Sam Wells
June Lang - Connie Armitage
John Litel - Hank Armitage
Marion Martin - JoJo (The Blonde)
Charles Wagenheim - Quimby (Insurance Adjustor)
Richard Bailey - Henry Simmons

Genres: Drama, Romance
Release date: January 10, 1947 
Filming location: San Pedro, California

@CultCinemaClassics

metadata.Plot: Looks like the film that might have inspired Hugo Haas to make one like it twice a year in the early fifties. Connie (June Lang) is all smitten with lighthouse keeper Sam Wells (Don Castle), but he brushes her off and she ups and marries his fellow-lighthouse keeper Hank Armitage (John Litel) out of spite. All three live together in the close confines of the lighthouse and jealously and recrimination rise nearly as high inside as the pounding surf and howling winds outside. It also begins to look like an Edgar G. Ulmer) film, if it wasn't so semi-rational. Sam is pleased with the situation that appears to him to promise action with no responsibilities. But Connie, in addition to rebuffing Sam's unwanted passes, is actually falling in love with ol' Hank. Trouble is brewing.
metadata.Actors: Don Castle, June Lang, John Litel
